title: Final value theorem
summary: In mathematical analysis, the final value theorem (FVT) is one of several similar theorems used to relate frequency domain expressions to the time domain behavior as time approaches infinity.[1][2][3][4] Mathematically, if f ( t ) {\displaystyle f(t)} in continuous time has (unilateral) Laplace transform F ( s ) {\displaystyle F(s)} , then a final value theorem establishes conditions under which
